name: Digoxin
indications: Digoxin is a cardiac glycoside indicated for: Treatment of mild to moderate heart failure in adults. (1.1) Increasing myocardial contractility in pediatric patients with heart failure. (1.2) Control of resting ventricular rate in patients with chronic atrial fibrillation in adults. (1.3)
contraindications: Digoxin dose is based on patient-specific factors (age, lean body weight, renal function, etc.). See full prescribing information. Monitor for toxicity and therapeutic effect. (2)
warningsAndPrecautions:
Digoxin Tablets have "N" on one side and are supplied as follows:

                                 Scored
                              
                           
                           
                              
                                 Color

                                 Unit dose packages of Ñ00 (10x10)
                              
                           
                        
                        
                           
                              125

                     Store at 25°C (77°F); excursions permitted to 15° to 30°C (59° to 86°F) [See USP Controlled Room Temperature] in a dry place and protect from light.
                  
                  
                     FOR YOUR PROTECTION: Do not use if blister is torn or broken.
 
                  
                     Keep this and all medication out of the reach of children.
adverseReactions:
Digoxin is contraindicated in patients with:
                  
                     Ventricular fibrillation
  
   [see
                        
                           Warnings and Precautions (5.1)
                        
                        ]
                     
                     Known hypersensitivity to digoxin (reactions seen include unexplained rash, swelling of the mouth, lips or throat or a difficulty in breathing). A hypersensitivity reaction to other digitalis preparations usually constitutes a contraindication to digoxin.
